Authors: Pradana H.A., Riza B.S., Naseer M., Soetarno D., Mantoro T.
Title: The effect of e-CRM towards service quality and net benefits using structure equation modeling
Source title: Proceedings of the 2nd International Conference on Informatics and Computing, ICIC 2017
Affiliations: STMIK Atma Luhur, Jl. Jend. Sudirman, Selindung, Pangkalpinang, Indonesia; Universitas Potensi Utama, Jl. K.L. Authors with affiliations: Pradana, H.A., STMIK Atma Luhur, Jl. Jend. Sudirman, Selindung, Pangkalpinang, Indonesia; Riza, B.S., Universitas Potensi Utama, Jl. K.L. Yos Sudarso Km 6, 5 No. 3-A, Tanjung Mulia, Medan, Indonesia; Naseer, M., STT Bandung, Jl. Soekarno-Hatta no. 378, Bandung, Indonesia; Soetarno, D., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Syahand Palmerah, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mantoro, T., Sampoerna University, L'Avenue Building, Jalan Pasar Minggu, Kav. 16, Jakarta Selatan, Indonesia
Abstract: E-CRM is currently one of the major keys of a company in achieving the target of selling their products. Most companies today, used e-CRM without any consideration the effect of using e-CRM, such as information that is not right in use and is limited to general information delivery. E-CRM must be observed and monitored continuously to determine the extent of services provided to the company to users and buyers of their products. It is then, e-CRM can affect a quality of service and the net benefits obtained company is doing well or not. E-CRM in many forms in conveying information about products produced by a company, usually in the marketing of these products. The relationship between the user and the company must be closely and maintained mutual trust. The better the monitoring and delivery of their e-CRM, was influential excellent in quality of service and the net benefits obtained companies become more than without the use of e-CRM. One of the companies that implement e-CRM is PT. Garuda Indonesia. PT. Garuda Indonesia promote e-CRM in providing good quality services so as to obtain net benefits of the implementation of e-CRM. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: e-CRM; net benefits; service quality; structure equation modelling
Index Keywords: Telecommunication services; General information; Indonesia; Mutual trust; net benefits; Quality services; Service Quality; Structure equation models; Structure equations; Quality of service

Authors: Sukmana H.T., Lestiani D., Anggraeni N., Soetarno D.
Title: The prototype of Zakat management system in Indonesia by using the social society approach: A case study
Source title: 2017 5th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management, CITSM 2017
Affiliations: Informatics Engineering, Science and Technology Faculty, Syarif Hidayatullah State Islamic University, Indonesia; Informatics Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmana, H.T., Informatics Engineering, Science and Technology Faculty, Syarif Hidayatullah State Islamic University, Indonesia; Lestiani, D., Informatics Engineering, Science and Technology Faculty, Syarif Hidayatullah State Islamic University, Indonesia; Anggraeni, N., Informatics Engineering, Science and Technology Faculty, Syarif Hidayatullah State Islamic University, Indonesia; Soetarno, D., Informatics Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: Giving alms (Zakat) to people in need is an obligation for Muslims to create justice for others. In Indonesia, there are already several institutions dealing with the issue for zakat, among others the body formed by the government, namely Badan Amil Zakat (BAZNAS) or a body formed by the community. Each Zakat institution already has a system used to register Muzaki (the person giving Zakat) and Mustahiq (the recipient of Zakat). However, there are some disadvantages to their system. First, the level of distribution of Zakat to the needy is still very low compare to the level of Zakat acceptance, which is about 60%. This is due to Mustahiq data owned by Zakat institutions are not real-time due to lack of officers in searching for Mustahiq data. Second, the data among the Zakat institutions that are still not integrated, thus allowing duplication of giving Zakat to the same Mustahiq. On the other hand, there is the possibility of Mustahiq not receiving any donations at all. In this research, we have created a new approach involving civil society to participate recommending Mustahiq's data and allow Muzaki to be able to give Zakat directly to Mustahiq. Then, we created a proxy database for communication among existing Zakat institutions. The result of this research is the design and prototype of new system. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Indonesia; Muzaki; social environment; Zakat; Zakat Information System Mustahiq
Index Keywords: Indonesia; Muzaki; Social environment; Zakat; Zakat Information System Mustahiq; Societies and institutions

Authors: Durachman Y., Chairunnisa Y., Soetarno D., Setiawan A., Mintarsih F.
Title: IT security governance evaluation with use of COBIT 5 framework: A case study on UIN Syarif Hidayatullah library information system
Source title: 2017 5th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management, CITSM 2017
Affiliations: Dept. of Info. System, Syarif Hidayatullah, State Islamic University (UIN), Jakarta, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara (BINUS) University, Indonesia; Dept. of Management, Bina Nusantara (BINUS), University, Indonesia; Syarif Hidayatullah, State Islamic University (UIN), Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Durachman, Y., Dept. of Info. System, Syarif Hidayatullah, State Islamic University (UIN), Jakarta, Indonesia; Chairunnisa, Y., Dept. of Info. System, Syarif Hidayatullah, State Islamic University (UIN), Jakarta, Indonesia; Soetarno, D., Bina Nusantara (BINUS) University, Indonesia; Setiawan, A., Dept. of Management, Bina Nusantara (BINUS), University, Indonesia; Mintarsih, F., Syarif Hidayatullah, State Islamic University (UIN), Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the application system TULIS in the Main Library of UIN Syarif Hidayatulllah Jakarta by using COBIT 5 framework focuses on the process of managing security (APO13) and managed security services and to know the gap and provide recommendations to top management of the Library. This study used Likert scale calculations. The results of this study are as score value for APO13 was 0.65 and for DSS05 was 0.87 which indicated that both were in the level of capability 1 (Performed Process) but security governance standard has not been well implemented yet. Moreover, value for to beAPO13 was 1.65 and DSS05 was 0.87 which indicated that both were in the capability level 2. Besides upgrading the system, having high standard security policy were among recommendations to overcome the problems. Firewall and SSL (Secure Socket Layer) needed to be implement into the system to protect any attacks. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: (Secure Socket Layer); COBIT 5; Evaluation; Firewall; IT Governance; Library Systems; Main Library of UIN Syarif Hidayatullah Jakarta
Index Keywords: Access control; Computer system firewalls; Security of data; COBIT 5; Evaluation; Firewall; IT governance; Jakarta; Library systems; Secure socket layers; Security systems
